meta.description: A quick family dinner that everyone will love, this macaroni cheese can also be made with vegetarian cheese.

1.6: 50g/2oz grated parmesan (or a similar vegetarian alternative)

method.1: Cook the macaroni in a large saucepan of boiling salted water for 8-10 minutes; drain well and set aside.

method.2: Melt the butter over a medium heat in a saucepan slightly larger than that used for the macaroni. Add the flour and stir to form a roux, cooking for a few minutes.

method.3: Gradually whisk in the milk, a little at a time. Cook for 10-15 minutes to a thickened and smooth sauce.

method.4: Meanwhile, preheat the grill to hot.

method.5: Remove the sauce from the hob, add 175g/6oz of the cheese and stir until the cheese is well combined and melted.

method.6: Add the macaroni to the sauce and mix well. Transfer to a deep suitably-sized ovenproof dish.

method.7: Sprinkle over the remaining cheddar and the parmesan and place the dish under the hot grill. Cook until the cheese is browned and bubbling. Serve straightaway.

meta.title: Seared feather blade of Wagyu beef with shallot rings, beetroot purée, curly kale, sautéed potatoes, beef jus

meta.description: Wagyu beef is the last word in luxury cuts of meat, balanced here with the earthy flavours of beetroot and kale.

3.2: 1 banana shallot, peeled, sliced into ½cm/¼in rings

4.4: 1 sprig fresh mint, 2 sprigs fresh mint, leaves finely chopped

5.3: 4 x 150g/5½oz 1cm/½in thick steaks from the Wagyu feather blade

5.4: 150ml/5½fl oz beef jus, or reduced beef stock

method.1: For the beetroot, place the beetroot and salt in a saucepan over a medium heat, and pour in enough apple juice to cover the beetroot. Cover with a lid and cook until the beetroot is tender.

method.2: Remove from the heat, and pour out a little of the juice and set aside. Blend the remaining pan contents in a food processor until very smooth, using the reserved juice if necessary to thin the purée a little. It should be thick and velvety . Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.

method.3: For the kale, bring a pan of salted water to the boil, and half fill a large bowl with iced-water. Add the kale to the boiling water and cook for two minutes, until tender, drain, and immediately place into a bowl of iced-water.

method.4: Once cool, drain from the ice-water and squeeze out any excess water.

method.5: To serve, melt a knob of butter in a pan over a medium heat, add the kale, heat through and finish with a twist of freshly ground pepper.

method.6: For the shallot rings, heat a deep fat fryer to 190C, alternatively heat vegetable oil in a deep-sided, heavy-bottomed pan until a breadcrumb sizzles and turns golden-brown when dropped into it (CAUTION: hot oil can be dangerous, do not leave unattended).

method.7: Set up three bowls, one with the flour, another with the beaten egg and a third with Japanese breadcrumbs.

method.8: Dredge the shallot rings first in the flour, then the egg, then Japanese breadcrumbs.

method.9: Gently lower the shallot rings into the hot oil and deep fry until golden-brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and then drain onto kitchen paper.

method.10: For the potatoes, cook the potatoes in boiling salted water with a sprig of mint.

method.11: Once tender, drain, and cut in half.

method.12: Heat the butter and rapeseed oil a large frying pan over a medium to hot heat, add the potatoes and gently fry until golden-brown.

method.13: Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper, and add the chopped mint.

method.14: For beef, heat the rapeseed oil in a frying pan till hot.

method.15: Season the beef all over with salt and freshly ground black pepper.

method.16: Add a knob of butter to the hot pan and pan fry on both sides till coloured, approximately three minutes on each side.

method.17: Remove the beef from the pan and set aside to rest for a couple of minutes.

method.18: For the beef jus, heat the beef jus through in a small pan, ready to serve. If you don't have beef jus, add good quality beef stock to the pan used to cook the beef, and cook over a medium heat until the volume has reduced and it has thickened and become flavoursome.

method.19: To serve, spoon the beetroot purée onto the plate, and top with the beef. Place some kale and potatoes alongside. Spoon over the beef jus and top with shallot rings.
